p: Pentacyclic triterpenes, secondary metabolites extensively found in the plant kingdom, are located in various parts of the plant, such as the bark, root and leaves. An important number of studies showed the curative potential of lupane-type pentacyclic triterpenes ( Figure 3) through various biological activities such as anti-inflammatory [ 28, 29], anticancer [ 30, 31], antioxidant [ 12], antiviral [ 13, 32], antiparasitic [ 33] or healing properties [ 17], all of them being confirmed through extensive research.
